1) Notice what's not working.
2) Understand why‚Äîwhat about it doesn't work & why did you start it?

5) Modify as needed.

text: I fully support the neurodiversity movement challenging normality as the correct way to live: I think most 'normal' people live unethically. But doing this does not then entail moral relativism. There can still be better and worse way to live, based upon harm we cause to others.

text: I typically lose followers whenever mentioning 'good ways to live' in relation to neurodiversity so I'll clarify this. By 'good ways to live' I mean being just and not doing harm to our fellow creatures. So I think this promotes, not detracts, from the social justice movement.

Take care

text:
"Neurodiversity", as an umbrella term, makes a certain amount of sense ‚Äî covering over autism, ADHD and the like. It has its value.

But it carries with it an implication  that a "neurodivergency" is not a disorder or disability, but simply "another variation" of human neurology.

If we are to understand that there is *neurodiversity*, then you need to acknowledge and define the differences that make us diverse.

It seems like people are using "neurodiversity" as somewhat of a "we are one race: the human race" kind of commentary on ableism and sanism.

text: @commaficionado It always has been. I don't think it's helpful to class things in discrete categories and say with certainty that X makes you neurodivergent, Y does not. Not only is it antithetical to the neurodiversity paradigm as a whole, but it also just doesn't make sense.

text:

text: @commaficionado "Neurodivergent" & "neurodiversity" are different things. "Neurodivergent" was coined by Kassiane Asasumasu, & has always included mental illness. ND means any mind that diverges from what *systems of oppression are primed to accommodate*. "Neurodiversity" includes neurotypical.
tokenized_text: <user> " neurodivergent " & " neurodiversity " are different things . " neurodivergent " was coined by kassiane asasumasu , & has always included mental illness . nd means any mind that diverges from what * systems of oppression are primed to accommodate * . " neurodiversity " includes neurotypical .

text:
3) Neurodiversity as Politically Charged

Despite neurodiversity being valuable, brain types are politically charged in a similar way to having a specific skin colour. Some neurotypes dominate society (neurotypical) while others are oppressed (neurodivergent).
tokenized_text: <number> ) neurodiversity as politically charged despite neurodiversity being valuable , brain types are politically charged in a similar way to having a specific skin colour . some neurotypes dominate society ( neurotypical ) while others are oppressed ( neurodivergent ) .

text:
2) The Neurodiversity Principle

Instead, it is held that everyone's brains are different. This is similar to the biodiversity experienced in nature. Nature is full of variation which is valuable. Brains can also have valuable variation. This is Neurodiversity.
tokenized_text: <number> ) the neurodiversity principle instead , it is held that everyone ' s brains are different . this is similar to the biodiversity experienced in nature . nature is full of variation which is valuable . brains can also have valuable variation . this is neurodiversity .

text:
1) The Rejection of the Medical Model

The medical model holds that there is a specific type of brain that is 'healthy/normal'. If a brain is not normal then it is 'abnormal' and needs to be fixed to a state of normality. 

The Neurodiversity paradigm rejects this.
tokenized_text: <number> ) the rejection of the medical model the medical model holds that there is a specific type of brain that is ' healthy / normal ' . if a brain is not normal then it is ' abnormal ' and needs to be fixed to a state of normality . the neurodiversity paradigm rejects this .

text:
The Neurodiversity paradigm consists of three main assumptions. 

1)The Rejection of the Medical Model
2) The Neurodiversity Principle
3) Neurodiversity as Politically Charged. 

Let's examine each of these individually.
tokenized_text: the neurodiversity paradigm consists of three main assumptions . <number> ) the rejection of the medical model <number> ) the neurodiversity principle <number> ) neurodiversity as politically charged . let us examine each of these individually .

text: Let's start with what a paradigm is. A paradigm is a set of assumptions which influence how a person views the world. The neurodiversity paradigm is thus a series of assumptions of how we view brains.

@SierraLost @FunFactsLulu That's the whole idea behind the neurodiversity concept?

Inclusion is a win, and a benefit, not a burden!

But for that, they need to see us as people, first.

And so we argue about language.

Because how we are talked about determines how, and as who, we are seen to be.
